title: February 18: Dia Sin Inmigrantes! Day Without Immigrants! (Charlotte)
description:
English below:

En las ultimas semanas, residentes de Charlotte han tenido que ver como sus familiares, amigos, vecinos y miembros de su comunidad has sido secuestrado violentamente por ICE.

Esto no fue una coincidencia. Cada vez que es tiempo de votar, residentes de Charlotte lo han echo a favor de nuestra comunidad imigrante. Ya sea con manifestaciones y protestas, o hasta en las ultimas elecciones, hemos echo claro nuestro apoyo a una comunidad con diversidas cultural. Nosotros valoramos nuestra comunidad immigrante, y no podemos empezar a nombrar los beneficios que aportan a nuestra ciudad, esta ciudad donde ellos viven y trabajan junto a nosotros.

Precisamente por la solidaridad y apoyo a nuestros vecinos imigrantes, es que a sacado el enojo de ICE y su agenda racista. En la eleccion de nuestro nuevo Sheriff, los residentes de Charlotte votaron por terminar el contrato de 287g y dejar de colaborar con ICE. Ahora ICE a tratado de intimidarnos y secuestrar a padres, y familiares de nuestra comunidad.

El siguiente Lunes Febrero 18, Comunidad Colectiva se junta con organizaciones estatales por otro llamado a un dia sin imigrantes para demostrar el valor que nosotros aportamos a la comunidad y a la economia. No iremos al trabajo y a la escuela.

Pedimos a todos que nos apoyen viniendo a una marcha en Marshall Park al medio dia (12pm). Traigan sus pancartas para que mandemos un mensaje fuerte a Sean Gallagher, ICE, Trump y todos los que estan contra imigrantes que no nos vamos a quedar sentados. La gente tiene el poder y no vamos a dejar que estos actos racistas se normalizen!

Muchos de nosotros hemos estado aqui antes que ICE y estaremos despues que ellos.
__________

In the past couple weeks, residents of Charlotte have had to endure their family, friends, neighbors and community members being torn from them by violent ICE operations targeting our fair city. This targeting of Charlotte was not coincidental. Every time it’s been put to a vote, Charlotteans have came out in full support of our immigrant community. Whether it be in mass rallies and marches in years prior, or in the most recent elections, we have made our support of a culturally diverse Charlotte crystal clear. We value our immigrant community and cannot measure the benefits they bring to Charlotte, our city in which they live and work along with the rest of us.

It’s precisely that solidarity and unwavering support for our immigrant neighbors that has drawn the ire of ICE and their white supremacist agenda. With the election of our new sheriff, the residents of Mecklenburg Co voted to terminate the 287g contract and stop collaborating with ICE. This is a trend that has spread across North Carolina and the nation as other cities end their collaboration with ICE as well. In an attempt to subvert the democratic will of the people, ICE has resorted to kidnapping fathers, mothers, parents from their homes and workplaces in broad daylight in hopes of intimidating us into backing down, submitting in the face of state violence and restoring 287g.

Next Monday the 18th, Comunidad Colectiva joins the statewide call for another day without immigrants to demonstrate the value immigrants bring to our community and economy, and how much we risk losing by capitulating and collaborating with ICE’s ethnic cleansing campaign.

We ask supporters and sympathizers, allies and accomplices, to show up en masse to Marshall Park at noon on Monday the 18th. Bring signs, banners and your marching shoes as we send a clear message to Sean Gallagher, ICE, Trump and the rest of the anti-immigrant that we will NOT stand idly by as they terrorize our community. The people hold the power and we will NOT allow these disgusting acts of racist state terrorism become the new normal!

Many of us have been here long before ICE existed and intend to be here long after it’s gone!

#AbolishICE
#DayWithoutImmigrants
#Venceremos
